comment: Smokey, sweet, lots of flavors, smooth, delicious
Sweet and easy on the pallete. A nice sipper
While I do like a bit of rye spice in my whiskey, this one goes way past that. It's strong enough they should actually label it rye.

Chill filter
Rye,  barley
Some bite
Ages 7-10

All around solid.  Not sure if was small batch or other normal variety.

Smells like should be spicier but isn’t.  Full bodied and classic aftertaste.  Nothing overly unique.

Really interesting combination of dark fruit on the nose that gives way to rye and spiciness. The spicy bite really lingers on the finish. There are other soft sweet flavors mixed in there as well, making for a nicely complex bourbon.

Pours a nice light to medium copper.  Subtle dark fruitiness, blending to vanilla in the nose.  Flavor is strong, but not complex and lacking layers or nuance.  But, this is a really good entry bourbon.  Cost is only $5-8 more than Jack Daniels, but much nicer.
Caramel, vanilla,  med-high spice at the end
Nose is full of heavy banana. Sweet on the palette, almost vanilla that gives way to fruit. Long finish- some spice but not overpowering. Does not disappoint.

Much more briny and punchy off the start than the Johnny Drum (Previous). Tastes of burnt green banana peel with residual sugars bubbling on the surface. Very long finish for a sub 94 proof bourbon. FULL FLAVOR. I can see why Chad loves this.

Nose-I get tons of banana bread, a little ethanol on the nose but not much.  After letting it sit for a minute I get a little warm honey I think.  Obviously you get a little oak which you’ll get with almost any bourbon.  This smells absolutely delicious.

Taste- on first taste I got some of the sweetness I picked up on the nose but after another taste I pick up a lot of oak.  I get an oily mouthfeel which is nice and makes my mouth instantly water.  This is a pretty spicy pour in my opinion, but take that with a grain of salt as I prefer wheated bourbons.  A few drops of water really opens this up.  More vanilla on the nose is immediately noticeable.  The water really gives makes this bourbon shine.  Picking up a little cinnamon, I think maybe some nutmeg and I think I’m picking up some raisin.  The vanilla from the nose comes in slightly but it’s really light.

Finish-the finish for me has a long spicy finish.  A little pepper and some cinnamon.  The spice stays for awhile as well.  I also get the oak on the finish.
On the nose I get ethanol with a hint of orange. On the palate there’s a little vanilla that possibly leads to melon. The finish leaves strong rye spice that goes long. Very enjoyable bourbon!

Rye spice. Caramel. Minty.  Can't really expect much more from a sub-$30 bottle. Will buy again.  I do not get 'hot' or 'burn' as others have noted. Very sippable - would not mix. Curious to try other expressions.

Nose: sweet caramel, vanilla, and fruit

Palate: sweet vanilla, rye, baking spices (cinnamon, nutmeg), hint of cherry and apple

Finish: medium sweet spicy finish
Paired with buttery gnocchi, balanced well. A little burn in the back and sides, sweet finish
It’s ok. An in the pocket bourbon. Nothing offensive. Easy to drink.
Smooth, with a little nice burn at the end
Sweet and smooth, with a bit of a peaty finish. Easy to drink and easy to find makes this a go-to.
Love it!!! The burn is the best part!!
A solid bourbon for the price

Nose: vanilla ice cream with some oak spice.

Body: normal well balanced. 

Palate: the delicious vanilla ice cream and the oak spice is more present than in the nose.

Finish: lingering vanilla ice cream. This is basically a liquid dessert.
Spicier than the others we’ve tasted but still nice and smooth
Ok. Can get better for the price

Deep copper appearance 

Brown sugar and vanilla aroma

Corn, spice, slightly sweet with a warm finish
Sweet and smooth then turns spicy. Afterburn.
Average bourbon. Quite the burn, but decent flavors. Worth a try.
Pretty smooth. Not a lot of bite.
Nothing too exciting.   It's a bourbon.
Classic bourbon taste, no offensive flavors. A bit hot, with an interesting watermelon candy taste in the finish.
Very smooth with a little fruitiness and caramel, not the rye sharpness that I expected. Definitely worth a repeat.
Not great. Love any 1792 full proof but the small batch left an odd taste. Meh

Classic bourbon flavours with heat. Pineapple taste? Maybe faint. Is a hot classic bourbon flavour to me. I’m a fan - if you like it spicy. A cold night, at a fire, where you think it may be getting just a bit too cold - and you’re catching a chill. This will cue that.
I agree with reviews saying it is smooth, sweet, pineapple start and spicy finish.  I get slight anise flavor at end.
Pineapple on initial sip, mellowed with a large cube
Great flavor for the cost. One of my dailys. Sweeter like wheated with vanilla/caramel notes.
My favorite low cost bottle. Excellent buttery mouth feel. Be careful to pair it with savory not sweet foods.

My second tasting of this was much better than the first. The first time I didn't get much other than oak. But on subsequent tastings it seemed to have settled down and I got big cherry notes on the pallet and not much bitterness from the barrel. I dig it and find it tough to rate. It's somewhere between a 3.75 and 3.5 for me but at the moment I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt and going with a 3.75. Maybe later tastings will change that.
Smooth start with a satisfying heat. Oak influences with a light orange and spice. Slight bitterness with some vanilla. Overall a very solid bourbon for the price tag.
Good balance. More rye than I typically like, but still very good.

Nez: alcool très dominant au début, presque à friction, qui heureusement s'amenuise après une quinzaine de minutes. Après ce repos, chêne, vanille et épices, un peu de miel, feuilles fraîchement tombées à l'automne, baies séchées. Bouche: forte entrée caramélisée et épicée qui est rapidement envahie un l'alcool très prenant. Celui-ci s'évapore tranquillement et laisse les saveurs de chêne apparaîtrent ensuite ainsi qu'un peu de vanille et un retour des épices. Fin de gorgée moyennement douce.
Harsh alcohal flvaor.  Much like a scotch
Smooth start but spicy burning finish
Good flavor! Reasonably smooth, spice and oak. Nose is astringent but taste is smooth
Better after bottle had been opened for awhile. Drop or two of water definitely helps brings everything out.
Almost buttery scent with a smooth, cinnamon flavor up front. A lingering spice and bitterness.
Oak barrel with thin saw dust from freshly cut oak

Quick hit review...after a long day moving my daughter into NC State, grabbed a late pour at the on campus hotel where we are staying. Saw it on the shelf and thought “What the heck?” A generous pour in a rocks glass yields lots of “red” notes (appropriate for NCSU). Cherry Cough Syrup, Red Apple, and Cinnamon. A healthy dose of bitter oak and tons of heat on the finish spoil this one. Better than I remember, but still only a 3.
Smooth finish, nice toffee and caramel flavor
Charred oak and cinnamon. Slow heat and star anise finish.
If you enjoy sipping gasoline, this one is for you. Very harsh.

Tasted this once in the past but couldn’t remember details as I only took a quick taste at a party. This time I went and bought a bottle. My thoughts are that this is a very good daily drinker that is very affordable and easy to find on the shelf. Not overly complicated bourbon but a pleasant easy drinking sweet bourbon that seems to find my mouth every day when I get home before the other dozens of bottles. At the $30 price point I think it’s a reasonable asking price.
A reliable go to entry level bourbon. Smooth with prominent vanilla and spices. Good for classy cocktails
Good dram but a little too much “alcohol” taste for my liking.
Rich toffee, nuts, caramel, light baking spice, some apple and cherry.

Not my favorite bourbon to be sure, but delicious nonetheless.  Compared to my normal preferences, I would call 1792 "bourbon light".  Light mahogany in color, light carmel at the beginning, decent char notes, but the fruit I get is kind of a watermelon/banana note.  Today , it finally dawned on me that this might be what Jack Daniels might be like if you upped the bottling proof and  didn't filter it with the Lincoln County Process.  Drink your bourbon!
Spicy with a burn on the finish
Sweet to the nose and a slow long linger finish. Great starter bourbon.
I dig it. For $8 a pour, I really dig it.

Nose: strong on ethanol, vanilla 
Palate: a little spicy but very little flavor
Finish: short finish and a little burn
smell has spice and bright fruit. Oak on the initial taste, mellows out to leather and smoke. Ends with a mild peat flavor and moderate oily coat. Long after taste. Well rounded classic bourbon
Hints of cherry.  Nice warming feeling with out being over powering

Not impressed with the aroma, although it smells pleasingly enough.  Burn is immediate on tongue.  Seems harsh but finish is flavorful.  Burn is good.  Added water for testing notes.  A few drops or even a little more water didn't make a diff.  For price comparisons, Larceny tastes better.
Nice bourbon with a bananabread and caramel nose along with taste. Light sweet finish.

Nose: Corn with a more lusty burn than normal. Candi Sugar sweetness that reminds me of Sugar Daddy candy pops. That extra 6.85% is not remotely obscured. Some charcoal, with an ashy feel. 

The finish is a lot milder, smoother and sweeter than the initial heat would indicate. It benefits from a long waiting period under the tongue, and patiently savoring it pays dividends. But that burn doesn't cool down without a lot more water or ice.
Spicy then smooth.  Pretty forgettable bourbon.  There are better options at the price point.  Gets better poured on an ice ball.
Vanilla, custard on the nose. Not much different on the pallet
Lots of ethanol on the nose.  Tastes young, but there are slight vanilla and butterscotch notes. Little bit of oak.
Had with 4 small ice cubes - nice and smooth flavor - would try again

Rye spice with a ton of ethanol. Hits with a little bit of acrid, almost green peppercorn immaturity. Just a second of caramel and fruit on the finish but that falls into a dusty roasted peanut right before the medium-length finish dies off.
Noses with sweet ethanol, typical vanilla and dried fruit tones. Hits the palate with cinnamon and stone fruits, not a lot of depth, finishes smooth and short.

Nose - bananas, vanilla, caramel, creme brulee, slight astringent quality from the oak

Palate - initial hit of sweetness, higher proof is evident. Rich oak and some nice rye spice following

Finish - lingering, spicy and rich.

A great Bourbon, full flavored and seems to be rye forward, although not ridiculously complex.  Very good Bourbon to sip, and would probably also make a great whiskey cocktail!
Decent bourbon. Not a ton of complexity, but relatively smooth at this price point. Slight burn on the finish, but it’s a good burn. Classic bourbon notes all around.
Pretty smooth. Sweet smell. Not super flavorful

Nose: Bananas, caramel, brown sugar, some maple syrup in there too.  Brings to mind banana waffles...

Palate: Mellow start to the tasting experience. Oily mouthfeel.  Then comes chewy toffee and oak.  Next, peppery rye spice coming through.  A lot of flavour but gets a bit heavy on the burn.

Finish: Short on flavour but long on burn. Lingering chili peppers and cinnamon. 

Overall a good bourbon with a lot of flavour. A bit harsh, maybe because it's 46.85%.  Maybe would open up a bit with a few drops of water?  May have to try this next tasting...
Sweet and easy to sip. Nothing too special but an excellent bourbon for its value.

Beautiful aroma, distinct flavor.

This has become a go to, but for some reason today seems to be giving off a hint of chocolate.
Lemons and flowers on the nose; graham crackers, toasted marshmallow, and butterscotch on the palate; peppercorns and coriander on the finish. One of my favorite low-proof bourbons.

If you drink your bourbon neat, this might not be your new favorite. Tasted a bit to me like some one melted some ice in it, then realized I wanted it neat so they fished the ice out and called it good.

It's smooth, but the aftertaste is kind of ... absent.
Semi sweet with some spice, lots of alcohol in the nose. The spice overpowers the sweet on the palate, spicy finish, strong pepper.
The taste in this bourbon was difficult to find until to get past the bite. I did find caramel and either maple or brown sugar. Good standalone bourbon or with minimal water.
My first purchase/intro to this addictive hobby. Nice caramel and oak nose. Boozy burn takes up the first half of taste detection. Remaining contains said caramel and solid rye notes.
Initial spice on the tongue, with cinnamon fading to fruits. Spice hangs on for a little bit
Sweet and smooth. Caramel with a note of brown sugar.

Keep in mind I am a beginner. 

Nose: floral and Aunt Jemima syrup.

Palate: off the bat I taste nothing but bulleit rye, immediately after it's a peppery aftertaste 

After: Mellow, smooth burn that is not overwhelming but not as smooth as youd expect from a small batch.
Sweet, yet a bit rough on the back—not too much age
Soft, earthy finish but missing a kick. Not much on the nose or the first sip. Bit of a leathery/oak taste at the end
Glencairn on the rocks. Great nose, even chilled. Smooth with a caramel finish.

Nose has high rye, oak, and leather. First sip offers a nice hug with hints of caramel, syrup, honey, vanilla and tobacco. A bit of water dulls the slight burn but opens floral and orange notes. A solid sipper improved with a splash.
Haven’t had in awhile need to touch back up on this one.

Nose: charred oak, caramel, 

Smooth, strong oak, hints of vanilla,  good drink
Light spice, too oily, easy drinking
Tasty, smooth, leathery and somewhat thick. Slightly spicy finish.
On the nose, rich and perfumey, caramel and a slight cherry note. On the pallet, pleasantly sweet very similar to the nose. The finish lingers with consistency for a long time.
Smooth, strong, and notes of vanilla

Very fruit sweet on the nose. Classic bourbon profile with cherry & vanilla.
A well-rounded palate. Still sweet but the barrel comes in the ground it and the sweetness turns a little floral.
The finish showcases more barrel and a sweet, toasted flower.
Lighter mouthfeel with solid complexity and lingering burn on the finish
Disappointing. Please stop ranking these things so highly. Faint earthiness with a heavy isopropyl overtone.
Highly underrated. Sweet, honey, floral, smooth, and lingers. Amazing with a cigar.
Nose - a little vanilla and oak up front. Taste - sweet almost carmel up front and then surprisingly a little spice on back. A very nice warm long lingering finish.
Had it among 9 other whiskey’s (including 6 Bourbons) in a blind tasting night and it didn’t stand out either way. Solid bourbon
smooth mellow bourbon with a hint of orange incredibly bold flavor on the finish. first tried this in kentucky at the LOVELY bartons distillery
Good Spicy, can taste that high rye content.

Nose - Nice Fruit nose with a dusting of cinnamon
Palette - Banana cream pie 
Finish - Middle of tongue, 20 second finish
Very nice daily sipper, great for bourbon newbies & around $30
I don’t get a whole lot on the nose except for slight hints of banana. Beginning starts off with a nice, sweet vanilla and honey ending with a long white pepper finish.
Stronger alcohol taste. Watered down tell it suited my palate. Honey/vanilla notes as well as a slight banana taste. Towards the end the spices hit the back of the palate.
Oak, vanilla, floral notes. For the price point this is a great bourbon.
Not great. Spicy and rough finish
Very tasty pour for the price. Smooth and elegant, overall a great value.
Smoother but one of the best

I was really looking forward to trying this after hearing many great reviews. Unfortunately I am a little disappointed. Very strong alcohol burn. Adding a few drops of water did open up the flavor. It could be that I just expected something completely different from the reviews.
This shit is bananas! Very odd for a rye but still has a long burn at the end.
Easy drinker. Not a lot of flavor.
Like it best on old fashioned

Disappointed with the first shot. I’m not a person who can described hints of this and scents of that. I can say it was not a totally favorable taste. With the second shot it is fine. With the third shot it tastes as good as any.

Nose: caramel, vanilla, rye spice
Taste: spicy rye and sweet vanilla. A thick bourbon. 
Finish: medium finish. Starts with spice and moves into sweet. 

Old fashioned:  spice holds up well to the sweetness. A very good old fashioned.
Classic Kentucky whiskey. Smells of the mash house. A little on the sweet side which I don’t mind.
Very, very, smooth. Sweet with notes of vanilla and a tiny bit of spice. But just right.
better nose than taste, a bit tart - okay, but I prefer others in the same price range ($20-30) - better after a few minutes
Good daily drinker. Not a high shelf bourbon, but for the price, would definitely buy again.
First Small Batch Bourbon I ever had. Very smooth. Tastes sweet. Tastes like it's had water added even when it's neat. Excellent!
Vanilla on the nose; butterscotch/buttered popcorn on the palate
Smooth easy drinking whiskey good on the rocks or with ginger beer.

Nose: sweet corn, vanilla, little baking spice
Palate: spice, white pepper, sweet corn
Finish: tobacco, long,

Nose: vanilla, maple, maybe a little citrus
Taste: brown sugar maple, a little cinnamon
